column4: this is not a linux/ubuntu q, but most ppl that i know that use pgp encryption are linux users..so ill ask it here if its alright

if i send an encryped email to person A, who has the correct private key to decrypt, and they send it to person B, who also has person A's private key, can the email be decrypted ? Basically what im asking is, is the key tied directly to the email address, or is the email address just used for identification
the key is all you need. the adress is just for making things easier
